summary: This is a court docket from the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in the case United States of America v. Ghislaine Maxwell (Case No. 21-58). It details procedural events from January to April 2021, including the termination of an attorney, the denial of a bail motion, and the affirmation of a lower court's decision, resulting in the case being terminated.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant appealing a case in the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit. Her attorneys filed motions on her behalf, including a motion for bail which was denied.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: An attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell whose representation was terminated by a court order on April 27, 2021.

persons.name: David Oscar Markus
persons.context: An attorney for the defendant-appellant Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as retained counsel from the firm Markus & Markus, PLLC.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: An attorney for the defendant-appellant Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as retained counsel from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim.

persons.name: Khadijah Young
persons.context: A new case manager assigned to the appeal on April 27, 2021.

connections.description: Everdell was an attorney representing Maxwell in her appeal, until his representation was terminated by court order.
Markus is listed as retained defense counsel for Maxwell in the appellate proceedings.
Stemheim is listed as retained defense counsel for Maxwell in the appellate proceedings.

events.title: Appeal Hearing
events.description: The case was heard before judges PNL, EIL, and RJS in the Court of Appeals.

events.title: Attorney Termination
events.description: The court granted a motion for attorney Christian R. Everdell to be relieved as counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Bail Motion Denied
events.description: The Court of Appeals denied a motion for bail filed by Appellant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Appeal Affirmed and Terminated
events.description: Pursuant to a court order, the appeal was affirmed, upholding the lower court's decision, and the case status was marked as terminated.

locations: United States Court of Appeals for the 2nd Circuit
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal (Case No. 21-58) in the Second Circuit was terminated on April 27, 2021, after the court affirmed the lower court's decision.
A motion for bail filed by Maxwell was denied by the appellate court on April 27, 2021.
Attorney Christian R. Everdell was relieved as counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell by court order on April 27, 2021.
The document lists multiple retained defense attorneys for Maxwell, including David Oscar Markus and Bobbi C. Stemheim.
The case docket indicates procedural steps in the appellate process, including a hearing and the assignment of a new case manager.
